faculty.name: Dr. Sanjay Parab
faculty.title: Vice Principal and Associate Professor
faculty.bio: Dr. Sanjay Parab, Vice Principal and Associate Professor, holds multiple qualifications including M.Com., M.A., M.Phil., Ph.D., LL.M., and FCS, with over 21 years of teaching experience. He has a keen research interest in Corporate Governance, Business Administration, and Corporate Finance, and was a university topper in Company Law during his LLB.
achievements: M.Com., M.A., M.Phil., Ph.D., LL.M., FCS
faculty.quote: Excellence in corporate governance and finance education drives sustainable business growth.

faculty.name: Mr. Pratik Purohit
faculty.title: Assistant Professor
faculty.bio: Mr. Pratik Purohit, Assistant Professor, holds an M.Com. in Accountancy, PGDFM, and M.Phil., and is currently pursuing a Ph.D. With 6 years of teaching experience, his research interests lie in Accountancy and Finance, Business Policy and Administration, and Management.
faculty.quote: Integrating theoretical knowledge with practical management approaches creates well-rounded financial professionals.

faculty.name: Ms. Kamalika Ray
faculty.title: Assistant Professor
faculty.bio: Ms. Kamalika Ray, Assistant Professor, holds an M.Com. in Accountancy, PGDBA (Finance), EPG in Data Analytics, and is a Certified TRP, currently pursuing a Ph.D. With 3 years of teaching experience, her research interests include Accountancy and Finance, ESG, and Personal Finance.
achievements: EPG in Data Analytics, Certified TRP
faculty.quote: Empowering students with data-driven financial insights and sustainable investment practices.

faculty.name: Mr. Vinayak Thool
faculty.title: Assistant Professor
faculty.bio: Mr. Vinayak Thool, Assistant Professor, holds an M.Com. degree and has 2 years of teaching experience. His research interests include Accountancy, Finance, and Digital Governance.
faculty.quote: Digital governance in finance ensures transparency and efficiency in modern financial systems.

faculty.name: Mr. Lloyd Serrao
faculty.title: Assistant Professor
faculty.bio: Mr. Lloyd Serrao, Assistant Professor, is a C.S., L.L.B., and Associate Member of ICSI with over five years of experience in corporate filings, FEMA, IBC, and compliances. With 2 years of teaching experience, his research interests include Finance, Corporate and Commercial Laws, and Banking.
achievements: C.S., L.L.B., Associate Member of ICSI
Over 5 years experience in corporate filings
Expert in FEMA, IBC, and compliances
faculty.quote: Understanding legal frameworks is essential for sound financial decision-making and corporate compliance.

leadership.name: Aaradhy Mehra
leadership.title: Chairperson – The Finance Symposium (TFS)
leadership.bio: Aaradhy Mehra is a driven student-leader and aspiring entrepreneur from the BAF batch of 2026–27 at St. Xavier's College, Mumbai. As Chairperson of The Finance Symposium, he curates strategic initiatives that connect finance, innovation, and enterprise through student-led forums and industry collaborations. He serves as Editor-in-Chief of Currency of Change, leading its editorial vision while mentoring contributors. A former Summer Intern at SBI Securities and a CUET 98%iler, Aaradhy pairs strong analytical thinking with a forward-looking approach to market trends and institutional strategy. His deep interests in technology, automobiles, and design reflect in his digital presence, where he has garnered over 1.5 million views on YouTube and built a professional network of 5,000+ followers on LinkedIn.
achievements: Sub-Head of Design – The Business Conference 2023–24
leadership.quote: Balancing entrepreneurial curiosity with creative insight, exemplifying next-gen leadership rooted in impact, innovation, and influence.

leadership.name: Akarsh Ojha
leadership.title: Vice Chairperson – Networking, The Finance Society (TFS) 2025
leadership.bio: Akarsh Ojha is currently pursuing a Bachelor's in Accounting and Finance at St. Xavier's College, Mumbai, and serves as the Vice Chairperson – Networking at The Finance Society (TFS) 2025. In this role, he leads strategic outreach, fostering connections with alumni, industry experts, and institutions across India and abroad. A Godha Family Scholar (2023) and Visiting Student at the University of Oxford (Trinity Term 2025) under the Betty and Keating Scholarship, Akarsh blends academic excellence with cross-disciplinary curiosity. He is the author of Nothing but Only You, a nationally acclaimed poetry collection, and a winner of multiple national literary and aptitude competitions, including an All India Rank 1 in a reasoning challenge. Raised in a remote village in Bihar, his journey from limited resources to global platforms reflects resilience, vision, and a deep belief in education as a force for transformation.
achievements: Visiting Student – University of Oxford (Trinity Term 2025)
leadership.quote: Education as a force for transformation can bridge any gap between limited resources and global opportunities.

leadership.name: Jatin Phulwani
leadership.title: Vice Chairperson – Management, The Finance Symposium (TFS)
leadership.bio: Jatin Phulwani is the only second-year student in the core trio of The Finance Symposium (TFS), where he serves as Vice Chairperson – Management. He is a two-time elected Course Representative of the BAF batch and a member of the Student Council at St. Xavier's College, Mumbai. Jatin has consistently led from the front, playing a pivotal role in streamlining internal operations, enabling team synergy, and ensuring flawless execution of the committee's flagship initiatives. As Organiser (OG) – Admin for Malhar 2025, one of India's largest student-run college festivals, he contributes with strategic foresight and unmatched precision. Crowned Mr. DPS at his school convocation — the highest honour awarded to a student — Jatin's leadership journey began early. He has earned certifications from IIM Bangalore, Wharton, and BCG, with expertise spanning strategy, consulting, and finance.
leadership.quote: Collaborative leadership and deep commitment to impact drives changemaking with an eye on the future.
